sen.j: 鹿せんべい（しか-）は、奈良市の奈良公園周辺で放し飼いの鹿に観光客が与える餌として販売されているものである。
sen.e: Shika senbei is sold in Nara Park of Nara City to tourists to feed free-range deer which are kept in and around the park.
sen.cmt: deer: 単数・複数形同語
sen.e: Shika senbei is sold in Nara Park, Nara City, to tourists for them to feed the deer that roam free in and around the park.
sen.cmt: "free-range" makes it sound as if the deer will later be eaten, which doesn't seem to be the case.
sen.e: Shika senbei are sold in Nara Park, Nara City, to tourists for them to feed the deer that roam free in and around the park.
sen.cmt: 訳がcrackersのため、複数扱いにします。

sen.j: 奈良の鹿愛護会が、製造販売しているもので、同会の登録商標となっている。
sen.e: The senbei is produced and sold by Foundation for the Protection of Deer in Nara Park of Nara, and it is also registered as a trademark of the Foundation.
The senbei is produced and sold by the Foundation for the Protection of Deer in Nara Park, and the trademark for these senbei has been registered by the foundation.
sen.cmt: The above sentence already tells us that Nara Park is in Nara so I have deleted " of Nara".
sen.e: The senbei are produced and sold by the Foundation for the Protection of Deer in Nara Park, and the trademark for these senbei has been registered by the foundation.

sen.j: 人間用の鹿せんべいは製造されていない。
sen.e: There is no Shika senbei made for humans.
Shika senbei is not meant for human consumption.
Shika senbei are not meant for human consumption.

sen.j: 材料
sen.e: Food Ingredients
Ingredients
Ingredients

sen.j: 米ぬかと穀類でできている。
sen.e: It is made from rice bran and grain.
Shika senbei is made from rice bran and grain.
sen.cmt: use of clear subject in new section
sen.e: Shika senbei are made from rice bran and grain.

sen.j: 砂糖が入っていないため、鹿に優しい。
sen.e: As being sugar free, it is healthy for deer.
As it is sugar free, it is good for the deer.
As they are sugar free, they are good for the deer.

sen.j: 人間が食べても害はないが、味はない。
sen.e: Although it is not harmful to humans, it has no taste.
Although it is not harmful to humans, it has no taste.
Although they are not harmful to humans, they have no taste.

sen.j: 与え方
sen.e: How to Feed
How to Feed
How to Feed

sen.j: 鹿は煎餅の売店で客がお金を払うのを見計らって群がってくる。
sen.e: Deer gather around you as soon as they see you buying Shika senbei at a senbei shop.
Deer gather around you as soon as they see you buying Shika senbei at a senbei shop.
Deer gather around you as soon as they see you buying Shika senbei at a senbei stand.
sen.cmt: ほとんどの場合店舗ではなく売店形式のためshop→standに変更しました。

sen.j: ここで煎餅を束ねている紙をはがすのに手惑うと、軽く頭突きなどをしてくるので注意が必要である。
sen.e: If you are slow unwrapping the senbei, an impatient deer will give you a light head-butt.
If you are slow unwrapping the senbei, an impatient deer will give you a light head-butt.
If you are slow unwrapping the senbei, an impatient deer will give you a light head-butt.

sen.j: 一枚ずつ鹿に与えながらゆっくり後ろに下がって行くと一頭一頭に与える事ができる。
sen.e: You can feed every deer you like by stepping backward slowly as holding out senbei one by one.
You can feed every deer you like by stepping backward slowly as holding out senbei one by one.
You can feed every deer by stepping backward slowly as holding out senbei one by one.
sen.cmt: 原文に自分の好きな鹿とはないため、you like を削除しました。

sen.j: ちなみに束ねた紙も鹿に与える事ができる。
sen.e: As the senbei's wrapping paper is also edible, you can feed it to deer.
As the senbei's wrapping paper is also edible, you can feed it to deer.
As the senbei's wrapping paper is also edible, you can feed it to deer.

sen.j: そしてせんべいがなくなったら、ぱっと手を開き、無くなったことをアピールする。
sen.e: Once you finish giving out all the senbei, open your hands to show that you have no more senbei.
Once you finish giving out all the senbei, open your hands to show that you have no more senbei.
Once you finish giving out all the senbei, open your hands to show that you have no more senbei.

sen.j: 半分を残して鞄などにしまっても、鹿は匂いでまだ残っている事に気付くので無意味。
sen.e: As deer can smell out any piece of senbei left in your bag, you have to give it all.
As deer can smell out any piece of senbei left in your bag, you have to give it all.
As deer can smell out any piece of senbei left in your bag, you have to give them all.

sen.j: イベント
sen.e: Event
Event
Events

sen.j: 鹿せんべい飛ばし大会が1993年以来、毎年若草山の山開きの日（春分の日）に行われている。
sen.e: The Shika-senbei Throwing Tournament has been held since 1993 on Spring Equinox Day when Mt. Wakakusa opens for its spring climbing season.
The Shika-senbei Throwing Tournament has been held since 1993 on Spring Equinox Day when Mt. Wakakusa opens for its spring climbing season.
The Shika-senbei Throwing Tournament has been held since 1993 on Spring Equinox Day when Mt. Wakakusa opens for its spring climbing season.

sen.j: 参加料は300円。
sen.e: The admission fee is JPY 300.
The admission fee is JPY 300.
The admission fee is JPY 300.

sen.j: 大会では大会用の特製サイズのせんべいが使われ、「投げたせんべいを鹿が食べてしまった場合、その鹿の右前足までの距離を記録とする」、｢計測済みのせんべいは鹿が食べるのでそのままにしておく｣などのルールがある。
sen.e: In the Tournament, mega-size senbei is used, and there are specific rules, such as; 'if a deer eats the senbei a player threw, the distance to the front right leg of the deer will be measured for his or her record', or 'leave the senbei already measured on the field for deer to eat.'

In the Tournament, mega-size senbei is used, and there are specific rules, such as; 'if a deer eats the senbei a player threw, the distance to the front right leg of the deer will be measured for his or her record', or 'leave the senbei already measured on the field for deer to eat.'

In the Tournament, mega-size senbei are used, and there are specific rules, such as; 'if a deer eats the senbei a player threw, the distance to the front right leg of the deer will be measured for his or her record', or 'leave the senbei already measured on the field for deer to eat.'

sen.j: ちなみに2008年までの大会公式最高記録は2008年度の59.0m。
sen.e: As of 2008, the contest's official record is 59.0 meters which was set in 2008.
As of 2008, the contest's official record is 59.0 meters which was set in 2008.
As of 2008, the contest's official record is 59.0 meters which was set in 2008.

sen.j: なお2008年8月の夏休み特別イベントでの臨時開催では74.55mの記録も出ている。
sen.e: There is also an unofficial record of 74.55 meters marked in the special tournament held during a summer vacation in August 2008.
There is also an unofficial record of 74.55 meters marked in the special tournament held during a summer vacation in August 2008.
There is also an unofficial record of 74.55 meters marked in the special tournament held during the summer vacation in August 2008.
sen.cmt: 2998年の夏休みと限定のためaをtheに変更しました。

sen.j: 恒例のように若草鹿之助のライブがある。
sen.e: As an annual event, Shikanosuke WAKAKUSA holds a live concert.
As an annual event, Shikanosuke WAKAKUSA holds a live concert.
As an annual event, Shikanosuke WAKAKUSA holds a live concert.

sen.j: テーマソング：鹿せんべいツイスト
sen.e: Theme song : the Shikasenbei Twist
Theme song : the Shikasenbei Twist
Theme song : the Shika senbei Twist
sen.cmt: タイトルに合わせ、鹿とせんべいの間にスペースを入れました。
